title: So, Yasuo and the preseason changes
body: Hi there, just curious will there be anything done with Yasuo since the new changes will end up giving him 100% crit after 2 items Statik and I.E)? I'm a bit concerned it will make him a bit too strong, especially with the mastery that heals him for critting. Any thoughts? Or has anyone played him on the P.B.E that would like to share their opinions of him?

replies.body: As a Yasuo main that's played him a few times on the pbe, he honestly doesn't really feel different. Less AD overall on the items hurts him quite a bit but is nicely counterbalanced by the increased amount of crit in the game. He really feels the same as he does now. Shiv scaling to higher damage is a nice buff but the lower amount of AD is a solid counterbalance to it.

>As a Yasuo main that's played him a few times on the pbe, he honestly doesn't really feel different.

You're right, he's OP on live too.
Yasuo hasn't been OP since his E got nerfed in 4.11. Get over it.

> [{quoted}](name=Slamurai Jack,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=7hPWq9YG,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2015-11-08T11:11:28.749+0000)
>
> Yasuo hasn't been OP since his E got nerfed in 4.11. Get over it.

this board never will and you know it lol
Doesn't his E still have a .1 second cooldown though with range that almost rivals ADCs?
His E has 475 range, less than every adc not Urgot or the new Graves.
Urgot is not an adc.
Urgot has been played bot lane in several pro matches.
So has Kennen. Last time Urgot was seen in competitive he was in solo lanes and that's where people tend to play him nowadays.
If they fill the position of ADC, they are the ADC, and so can be considered as ADC's.
Change your name to Hoe Slayer because you're slaying all the Yasuo mains

Yea we get it, you're a blind fan boy, now you show yourself out.

I don't, but I have a take about him now, it doesn't matter if he's op or up, he's one of the most toxic piles of bullshit that will exist in LoL, playing against him will make anyone miserable, and you know it, because that sustains you, making your opponent hate his life.

You're right about that, although I'll make you hate life no matter what champion I'm playing. I will happily play Vel'koz against you and make him feel like the most broken piece of shit you've ever played against. That's what playing against someone really good at their champion always feels like.

> [{quoted}](name=Slamurai Jack,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=7hPWq9YG,comment-id=00020001000000000000,timestamp=2015-11-08T12:48:24.507+0000)

Nah, just some bullshit ones, I gladly lose to Vel'koz or Viktor, but playing such a mage against yasuo will be miserable, plus stop being so full of yourself, climbing with yasuo isn't hard.
It's not just that you think his design is flawed, you've got a serious hate-on for the guy. If you say Jack's biased, then what's that make you?

> [{quoted}](name=IronwallJackson,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=7hPWq9YG,comment-id=0002000100000000000000000001,timestamp=2015-11-08T13:19:49.328+0000)
>
> It's not just that you think his design is flawed, you've got a serious hate-on for the guy. If you say Jack's biased, then what's that make you?

Seriously now the guy need someone to defend him? 90% people qq about yasuo because he's not fun to play against, it's frustrating when he starts to dash around and when you finally think you can land something BOOM windwall to the face and then dashes back through another minion, if there are non he stays back and waits for minions, same shit every time and of course there is his waveclear, I will waste tons of fuckin mana to push the wave while he will yell HASAGI or something and with 1 Q he's good while not needing any mana.

People also complain about lots of other champions, and while a lot of those complaints are grounded in legitimate grievances or points of contention, there's stuff that goes deeper.

For example, I dislike Tryn's ult because it's the least elegant way possible of ensuring he survives a face to face engagement. Similarly, I dislike the specific combination of abilities that allow Vayne to effectively duel multiple enemies and tear through dedicated tanks without any measure of direct counterplay other than applying cc and bursting her down. **But**, I don't immediately dismiss someone's opinion just because they think differently about either of those champions.

Also, to address your complaints, yes, Yasuo can dash, has a powerful wall, and a recharging shield. Yes, his kit has a lot going on, but that's there because he needs all of it to succeed. Champions that need to get in melee range are almost always some combination of tanky and bursty, but Yasuo has neither. His defenses are straight mid-lane-mage-tier garbage and his damage is largely sustained rather than coming all at once. He's a melee ad carry by design.

Range is very, very powerful, and Yasuo needs ways to counter it since he can't face tank it or engage and kill you before you can react. That's why his kit is loaded with counterplay against ranged champions. And that's also why he can't face down anything else that wants to get in melee range. Because he's squishy as hell and nothing else that wants to go toe to toe _is_.

You know what his kit would look like if you strip his counterplay measures? You're left with a champion that can't survive in any lane, and is therefore useless. The alternative is to buff his defensive stats, and let him be tanky while also having really high sustained DPS, and nobody wants to see that. That or just make him into an actual assassin, which goes against his core design.

> [{quoted}](name=IronwallJackson,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=7hPWq9YG,comment-id=000200010000000000000000000100000000,timestamp=2015-11-08T14:45:00.477+0000)

Champions that need to get in melee range are almost always some combination of tanky and bursty, but Yasuo has neither. His defenses are straight mid-lane-mage-tier garbage and his damage is largely sustained rather than coming all at once. He's a melee ad carry by design.
> 
> Range is very, very powerful, and Yasuo needs ways to counter it since he can't face tank it or engage and kill you before you can react. That's why his kit is loaded with counterplay against ranged champions. And that's also why he can't face down anything else that wants to get in melee range. Because he's squishy as hell and nothing else that wants to go toe to toe _is_.
> 
> You know what his kit would look like if you strip his counterplay measures? You're left with a champion that can't survive in any lane, and is therefore useless. The alternative is to buff his defensive stats, and let him be tanky while also having really high sustained DPS, and nobody wants to see that. That or just make him into an actual assassin, which goes against his core design.

I don't see many tanky champs mid against him. The thing most people are complaining is the laning phase, it's pure cancer, if I am a mage with mana I am fucked, not to mention if I have skillshots.

Tanky champions aren't usually sent mid because then you're either out a mage or the displaced party member then has to deal with being in top lane, which is less safe because of both the champions one finds there and the length of the lane itself.

As far as skillshot reliant champions go, they'll have some trouble in the laning phase, yes, but those problems have solutions.

If the enemy yasuo is playing aggressively and/or sending full waves to your tower?

Aside from farming under the safety of that tower, you call for ganks. He has no built in escape other than his dash which might not even be useful depending on the angle of engagement. The gank doesn't even have to result in the kill so long as it makes him act with more caution. And if it doesn't? Camp the lane, because I guarantee he won't escape every time.

If he's dodging/negating all of your harass or denying you farm with his W? 

Focus on your farming and not on whittling him down, then poke when his W is on it's huge CD. Also, the ganking thing again. He can't play aggressively without making himself very vulnerable.

I like you, well reasoned and thought out (non biased too). I think it is important to point out that a yas with a pushed in wave has no mobility whatsoever, ganks are 90% of the time lethal then when the jgler has some form of cc. 

Especially a ramus or a shen with their taunts

Thank you. The point you make is also absolutely true. Hell, even with a minion wave there, escape can be difficult since Yasuo will often be forced to run into enemy territory, which is less than optimal.

If there's no minions at all, the situation is worse, as his only recourse becomes burning his flash and _maybe_ doing something slippery with your E, which is then entirely dependent on the enemies' positions.
Word.

That is incredibly difficult still, as doing something slippery with your e relies on your opponent's inability to respond to your action and even then they will likely predict where you plan to go for your escape

That's great if you're a jungler, but if you're a mid laner, you have pretty much no option but to constantly be shoved into your tower and down a fuck load of CS. All the while, he has effectively no resource, and you're scrambling to build mana to just farm, while ALSO needing to build armor. If the Yasuo is smart, he'll windwall so you can't even auto / CS under your turret for minions lol. It's honestly really shitty to play against. At least with someone like Zed, he cant hard shove me level 1.

???

I said you call up your jungler for a gank, not that junglers themselves have anything to do with his laning. If Yasuo pushes all the way up to your tower **and** is burning his W to deny the enemy farm, then he's doing everything in his power to make himself open to ganks.

I'm serious; ask your jungler to camp your lane if that happens, because then Yasuo either feeds you from the ganks or he backs the hell up and relieves presssure.

I know junglers are going to do however it is that junglers are going to do. But seriously, the answer to pretty much every very unfavorable matchup is jungler support. That's one-third of their job during the laning phase.

Saying that calling for your jungler isn't valid is bull, Since that's one of Yasuo's built-in weaknesses. Next you'll tell me that poking with an auto, backing off, and **then** comboing isn't a valid way to trade, or that it's impossible to just walk through or around his incredibly high cooldown wall.

If he's being aggressive enough to push you to tower and deny farm, then punish him for it. If he's doing that, it's because he thinks your team is too scrub to do anything about it, so prove the motherfucker wrong and exploit how gankable he is..

EDIT: I think I replied to myself?

I don't think you realize that as a mid laner, you ultimately have no control over whether your jungler ganks or not. His counter-play is reliant on two people sititng in his lane, which opens up quite a bit of pressure everywhere else on the map. This isn't healthy gameplay interaction. If Yasuo is smart, he'd also call for a counter-gank. So saying "rely on your jungler camping your lane" is not a serious argument that his laning phase is healthy.

I remember a time when everyone said Yasuo's early laning sucked ass. It was on release, when he was at his most powerful. He has been nerfed a number of times since then.

So, is his laning trash, or is it god-tier? :shrug: I Think its good.

Or you could aa him once to drop his passive shield, throw out a spell with a 10 second cooldown to get the wall, then smack him in the face with hard cc....and he's dead because he has pathetic base health. The wall has somthing like a 25 second cooldown, it's not that hard to play around. If you phrase it the way you did, you can make any trash tier champ sound OP.

> [{quoted}](name=darkmatchwaldo,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=7hPWq9YG,comment-id=000200010000000000000000000100000001,timestamp=2015-11-08T15:13:41.415+0000)

If he's not a retard from silver he won't get baited to use the shield for that, plus the main problem with that logic is pushing power, if I am a skillshot reliant APC who has mana that lane is pure hell, just played a game as Veigar against him, i'd rather be shot then repeat that, I won but it doesn't matter, the laning phase was cancer incarnate, he pushes constantly with his resourceless clear while I barely have mana to farm q plus push the wave. Also I never said it is impossible to win against him, it's the gameplay revolving him, pure toxicity.

Yeah that's a good point lol sorry if i came off as a dick, i didn't mean for it to be rude. I used to despise laning against him but now that i've played a bunch of games as him, I don't really have issues with him anymore. Also, i'm a retard in silver so baiting his shield is like insanely easy to do lol.
Why don't you stop being so full of yourself dude you're acting like a complete ass. You just come off as this salty player who's been stomped too many times by average yasuo players.

I don't pick Yasuo to climb mate. He's just my favorite and go to champion. When I want to climb, I play {{champion:161}} {{champion:10}} {{champion:86}}. Especially Vel'koz. He's my freelo champion when I really need to win games. Yasuo's honestly not even that great, but hell, he sure is fun to play.

As another Yasuo main that recently hopped onto the boards, let me say until I saw all the hate on the forums, I was hoping for a slight QOL buff to yasuo. I've played him on the PBE and the mastery heals once every 2 seconds, making it strong but not broken. Honestly, I agree with Jack in that he feels much the same as he is now, just with power in different places

EDIT : Incoming downvotes with no reason

The only logical points people have brought up against this guy is that it's annoying to play against Yasuo. Good job man. But that really doesn't address what he's said.

they want the champions they collectively hate to be as weak as possible and want sona to be the best support in the game all at the same time

> [{quoted}](name=Enosense,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=7hPWq9YG,comment-id=000200020001,timestamp=2015-11-08T20:04:31.569+0000)

Oh look, you made a little man out of straw, aww so cute.

Youre doing what youre accusing others of: Being unreasonable because they dont agree with me.

They dont want him to be as weak as possible, thats what you pretend they want so you can dismiss complaints about him.

Yes people make biased arguments, but the biggest number one complain about Yasuo is he "isnt fun to play against." This is due to his kit being full of counters, and full of high burst. He singlehandedly counters every mage in the game basically, can terrorize marksmen too, and can outburst other assassins.

Not fun to play against is very subjective and definitely hard to "balance," but it boils down to "Nothing you do will be effective enough to stop Yasuo from farming, and becoming strong enough to kill you or your team 1v1 no matter what." Not being able to impact your lane simply "Because Yasuo" is toxic, laning against him puts a bitter taste in someones mouth, and breeds hate for everything that he can do.

People tend to hate on champs because they have mechanics that are just broken. Yasuo is constantly running around, has dashes, but for some reason gets a broken ass "fuck you button" known as Windwall just to ignore even more skillshots so he can farm in peace... He dosnt have to dodge skillshots like others, he just blocks them, then when youre stuffs on cooldown he dashes you.... FUN ISNT IT!" Should he mess up and actually get hit... no big, free shield for sustain..... cause.... more fuck you, passive fuck you in the shields case.

Face it, everything Yasuo does is designed to thwart any and all attempts to harass him to get him low, and then make a kill play against him. While at the same time he has a kit to quickly approach and injure his enemies. This makes counter play against a good Yasuo so narrow as to be nearly non-existent. Its this narrow window of attack, while he has free farm the rest of the time, a huge threat zone of YOUR ENTIRE minion wave that makes laning against him a pain people have trouble tolerating.

Yasuo is also really popular, so that kinda helps shed a little light on his power... oh, yeah no just Yasuo lovers only right? I mean Vayne was declared the uber META ADC and only every game everyone played in the last 1/3 of this season had someone trying to dickride the most META ADC... so dont act like people arnt/havent been doing the same with Yasuo and his popularity. You know what really makes a champ popular, winning games with them when they have an oppressive kit with too much kill power, and tons of safety bolted on top.

You want a "reasonable" discusion? Then start with acknowledging that there is a lot of hate for the champ, and trying to figure out why, then discuss either solutions for one to aleviate the frustration in the game, or fixes for the champ because theyre broken.

Either way, deeming people unreasonable and therefor of no substantive opinion so you wont be forced to give your own substantive opinions is... unreasonable.
Yas is already too strong. These new items will make him perma banned. Which is great because Riot will finally be forced to fix him.

They've fixed him before by throwing nerfs around. I've had some time with him on the PBE as well and can confirm it's not that much better. You don't have access to the new passive until at least your first back, and even then it'll be unreliable until you finish a shiv.

Yeah, you get 100% off of two items, but that's not all too different from how it is on live. Hell, with the lowered damage on most of the items he builds, he's certainly taking a hit to go along with those indirect buffs. Honestly, it feels more like his mid game power spike is more noticeable because of the mastery and Shiv changes, but it largely evens out by end game either way.

>Yeah, you get 100% off of two items, but that's not all too different from how it is on live. 

He gets 100% crit for 3300 gold, you only need SS and a Cloak. You can also start brawlers and get away with it thanks to the crit vamp mastery.
 
On live you need 7400 gpld for 100% crit chance. You can get 96% for 6700, either way it's still double what you'd need for 100% on the PBE. 

Denying that this is a massive buff is just wrong.

>Honestly, it feels more like his mid game power spike is more noticeable because of the mastery and Shiv changes, but it largely evens out by end game either way.

Outside of Bronze mid game is more important than late game. You can use your mid game to win the game before late game champs can even react.

First, the Brawler start: No. You get sustain, yes, but it's going to be low, not as consistent as either Doran's Blade or Cull, and you'll lack the benefits of either item.  I run 17% crit (2x from passive) in my runes, as well as lifesteal, and Brawler's Glove is still pretty suboptimal.

Now I'll compare numbers. On live, buying Shiv + cloak will, on average, make his Q deal 100+Base Attack x 2 x 0.75 (x 0.8 to account for 80% crit chance) damage before mitigation. On the PBE, the crit is a flat 100%, that turns into 100+Base Attack x 2 x 0.75. At level 10, that will be 216 and 270, respectively. Now knock off 33% of that off of a measly 50 base armor and that difference shrinks down to 33 damage. Your auto attacks are at ~115 and 144, which shrink to ~77 and ~96 after armor.

Honestly? I'm not very impressed by those numbers. They're something, sure, but they don't look cataclysmic. Worst case scenario?  They mess with Yasuo's AD growth because the balance team guys want to push crit chance and weaken Infinity Edge and they don't seem likely to mess with either Shiv or IE's crit numbers.

I miss playing old morde against him 

Seeing him use wind wall against my E just to take damage anyway since isn't a skill shot is priceless

You mean yasuo gets 60% crit from {{item:3087}}  alone, just get {{item:1018}} and you sit on 90%. 

When you first arive in lane Yasuo is manageble but already frustrating to play against as soon as he gets {{item:3086}} the bullshit starts. Then he spikes like crazy hard on {{item:3087}} and now that item is getting buffed -.-

> You mean yasuo gets 60% crit from {{item:3087}}  alone, just get {{item:1018}} and you sit on 90%. 

Crit cloak gives 20% on the PBE, Shiv/Cloak is 100%.
You are right, i missed that part. Well thats even more op then, I gues +10% crit damage runes and no more downside to the passive either.
